question: What should I check before contacting support?
answer: Before writing to support, you should consider checking the system status page and the Known issues page to see if the problem you're experiencing has already been reported.

question: What is an important requirement for the email address I use to contact support?
answer: You must ensure that the email address from which you are writing is registered in your account, so the ticketing system will be able to recognize you automatically.

question: How can I get faster and more accurate assistance from support staff?
answer: A well-written question or a detailed problem description will likely result in faster and more accurate assistance from our staff.

question: What kind of email subject lines should I avoid when contacting support?
answer: Avoid vague email titles like 'Something is wrong' or 'Nothing works' as they will take a long time to resolve due to the need for additional information.

question: What should I include in the subject line of my support email?
answer: In the subject line of the email, include the system/cluster name and a few words describing what may be wrong, for example, 'Job 123456 fails to run on the Cedar cluster'.

question: Should I use an old email thread for a new support request?
answer: No, please do not request help on a different topic as a follow-up to an old email thread. Instead, start a brand new one to avoid re-opening an old ticket.

question: What is the email address for questions about accounts?
answer: For questions about accounts, send an email to accounts@tech.alliancecan.ca.

question: Which email address should I use for questions about account renewals?
answer: For questions about account renewals, send an email to renewals@tech.alliancecan.ca.

question: Where should I send questions about Globus file transfer services?
answer: Questions about Globus file transfer services should be sent to globus@tech.alliancecan.ca.

question: What is the email address for questions about Cloud resources?
answer: For questions about using Cloud resources, send an email to cloud@tech.alliancecan.ca.

question: Which email address is for questions regarding the Resource Allocation Competition (RAC)?
answer: Questions about the Resource Allocation Competition (RAC) should be sent to allocations@tech.alliancecan.ca.

question: What is the general support email address for issues not covered by specific categories?
answer: For any other question or issue, send an email to support@tech.alliancecan.ca.

question: What information is required in a support request to help staff better?
answer: To help us help you better, please include the Cluster name, Job ID, Job submission script, File(s) containing error message(s), Commands executed, Software (name and version), and When the problem happened.

question: How should I provide my job submission script in a support request?
answer: You can provide the full path of the script on the cluster, copy and paste the script into the email, or attach the script file.

question: How should I include error messages in my support request?
answer: You can give the full path of the file(s) which contain the error message(s), copy and paste the file(s) content, or attach the error message(s) file(s).

question: Should I send screenshots in my support request?
answer: Avoid sending screenshots or other large image attachments except when absolutely necessary, as the plain text of your commands or job script is usually more helpful.

question: What should I do if I want support staff to access or modify my files or account?
answer: If you want us to access, copy or edit your files, or inspect your account and possibly make changes there, you should state so explicitly in your email. This isn't needed if you've already granted permission via the CCDB interface.

question: Is there any sensitive information I should never send in a support request?
answer: Never send a password in your support request.

question: What is the maximum attachment size for support emails?
answer: The maximum attachment size for support emails is 40 MB.
